name: Oculus Rift
description: Oculus Rift was a line of virtual reality headsets developed and manufactured by Oculus VR (now Meta)

name: Echo VR
description: Echo VR was a virtual reality multiplayer game developed by Ready at Dawn Studios where players compete in a zero-gravity sport called Echo Arena.

name: Pebble
description: Pebble was a smartwatch developed by Pebble Technology featuring a 1.26 inch black and white memory LCD using an ultra low-power "transflective LCD".

name: Pebble 2
description: Pebble 2 was a smartwatch developed by Pebble Technology featuring a heart rate monitor, microphone, and water resistance rated for a depth of 30 meters.

name: Pebble Time
description: Pebble Time was a smartwatch developed by Pebble Technology, it was the first Pebble to introduce a color e-paper display, as well as a microphone, a new charging cable and a new Pebble Time-optimized operating system.

name: GoPro Karma Drone
description: GoPro Karma Drone was a camera drone compatible with GoPro Hero cameras featuring 20 minutes of battery life and a stabilizer.

name: Beme
description: Beme was a mobile application created by Matt Hackett and Casey Neistat featuring video sharing and a social network.

name: Narrative Clip
description: Narrative Clip was small wearable capable of automatically take a picture every 30 seconds whilst being worn throughout the day, a practice known as "life-logging".

name: Houseparty
description: Houseparty was a social networking service that enabled group video chatting through mobile and desktop apps. Users receive a notification when friends are online and available to group video chat.

name: Vine
description: Vine was a social networking short-form video hosting service where users could share six-second-long, looping video clips.

name: Essential PH-1
description: Essential PH-1 was a smartphone featuring a titanium and ceramic body, an edge-to-edge display protected by Gorilla Glass 5, and two rear cameras, one of which was dedicated to black-and-white photography.

name: Mailbox
description: Mailbox was a email management application that introduced innovative features, such as swipe-based email sorting, snoozing and filtering.

name: Flappy Bird
description: Flappy Bird was a mobile game where the player controls a bird, attempting to fly between columns of green pipes without hitting them.

name: Boosted Board
description: Boosted Board was a premium electric skateboard with a top speed of 35 km/h and max range of 11 km.

name: Game Boy
description: Game Boy was an 8-bit handheld game console developed and manufactured by Nintendo. Featuring a dot-matrix screen with adjustable contrast dial, five game control buttons and a single speaker with adjustable volume dial.

name: Game Boy Color
description: Game Boy Color was handheld game console developed and manufactured by Nintendo. Unlike the original Game Boy it featured a color screen.

name: Virtual Boy
description: Virtual Boy was a 32-bit tabletop portable video game console developed and manufactured by Nintendo. Featuring a head-mounted display with a red monochrome display.

name: Game Boy Advance
description: Game Boy Advance was a 32-bit handheld game console released by Nintendo as a successor to the Game Boy Color.

name: Nintendo DS
description: Nintendo DS was a handheld game console released by Nintendo that introduced two LCD screens working in tandem (the bottom one being a touchscreen), a built-in microphone and support for wireless connectivity.

name: Nintendo 3DS
description: Nintendo 3DS was a handheld game console released by Nintendo and featured the ability to display stereoscopic 3D effects without the use of 3D glasses or additional accessories.

name: Steam Controller
description: Steam Controller was a game controller developed by Valve, it featured two clickable trackpads with haptic feedback (as opposed to the more typical thumbsticks), and fourteen buttons, including face, shoulder, and undergrip buttons.
